Released on March 23, 2004 on [[Sub Pop]], it was the first non-solo effort by [[Sam Beam]] under his Iron & Wine moniker. Limited edition copies of the vinyl LP came with a bonus 7" vinyl single. Limited edition copies of the CD came with a bonus CD single. The album's title comes from the lyrics of the song "Passing Afternoon": "There are things that drift away like our endless, numbered days." ==Significance== The album marked a change in Iron & Wine's sound, as it was his first produced in a professional studio. Beam's only previous album, ''[[The Creek Drank the Cradle]]'', was recorded entirely on a four-track mixer at his home.<ref>[http://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/4127-our-endless-numbered-days/ Album review on Pitchfork]</ref> ==Track listing== #"On Your Wings" - 3:53 #"Naked as We Came" - 2:33 #"Cinder and Smoke" - 5:44 #"Sunset Soon Forgotten" - 3:20 #"Teeth in the Grass" - 2:22 #"Love and Some Verses" - 3:40 #"Radio War" - 1:56 #"Each Coming Night" - 3:28 #"Free Until They Cut Me Down" - 4:35 #"Fever Dream" - 4:16 #"Sodom, South Georgia" - 4:59 #"Passing Afternoon" - 4:01 *7" vinyl single #"No Moon" #"Sinning Hands" *Bonus CD #"Cinder and Smoke" (demo) #"Swans and the Swimming" #"Free Until They Cut Me Down" (demo) #"Hickory" ==Japanese Version Bonus Tracks== #"Belated Promise Ring" #"Homeward, These Shoes" ==Appearances in Popular Media== "Passing Afternoon" was played at the end of "Wilson's Heart," the finale of the fourth season of [[House (TV Series)|House]]. "Naked as We Came," "Trapeze Swinger" (a song not in this album) and "Sunset Soon Forgotten" were featured in the 2004 [[dramedy]] "[[In Good Company (2004 film)|In Good Company]]". "Each Coming Night" is featured in [[Miley Cyrus]]'s 2009 film [[The Last Song (film)|The Last Song]].<ref name="amazontracks">http://www.amazon.com/dp/B003C2WQ46</ref> "Naked As We Came" is featured at the end of the 4th episode of the 2nd season of [[The L Word]], when Jenny has her hair cut by Shane. ==References== <references></references> {{Iron & Wine}} [[Category:Iron & Wine albums]] [[Category:2004 albums]] [[Category:Sub Pop albums]] {{2000s-folk-album-stub}}
